meanings.definition: Causing difficulty; hard to do or deal with.
meanings.sent1: The math problem was so awkward that I couldn't solve it.
meanings.sent2: It was awkward to carry all the groceries in one trip.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle while riding a unicycle was an awkward sight.
meanings.sent4: The awkward puzzle of life's mysteries remained unsolved.
meanings.sent5: The awkward dance of the planets mesmerized the stargazers.

meanings.sent1: His awkward attempts at painting resulted in messy artwork.
meanings.sent2: She felt awkward trying to play the piano without practice.
meanings.sent3: The awkward chef burned the toast and scrambled the eggs.
meanings.sent4: His awkward fingers fumbled with the delicate origami paper.
meanings.sent5: The awkward juggler dropped the balls more often than not.

meanings.sent1: His awkward behavior at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She felt awkward when she accidentally interrupted the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The awkward guest spilled their drink on the host's carpet.
meanings.sent4: The awkward silence that followed his joke was deafening.
meanings.sent5: Her awkward apology only made the situation more tense.
